title: Truffle Config instantiates providers for all defined networks and sends API requests on deployment even if network is not selected.
body:
- [ ] I've [opened a support ticket](https://trufflesuite.zendesk.com/hc/en-us/requests/new) before filing this issue.

---------------------------

## Issue

Given the following `truffle-config.js`

``` javascript
matic: {
provider: () => {
        return new HDWalletProvider(
          maticMnemonic,
          `https://polygon-mumbai.infura.io/v3/MUMBAIKEY`
        );
      },

      network_id: 80001,
      confirmations: 0,
      timeoutBlocks: 200,
      skipDryRun: true,
    },
   
      network_id: 3,
      confirmations: 0,
      timeoutBlocks: 200,
      skipDryRun: true,
    },
    rinkeby: {
      provider: () => {
        return new HDWalletProvider(
          maticMnemonic,
          `https://rinkeby.infura.io/v3/RINKEBYKEY  `
        );
      },

      network_id: 4,
      confirmations: 0,
      timeoutBlocks: 200,
      skipDryRun: true,
    },
```

While deploying Truffle will make RPC calls to all networks defined in config. Performing a deployment to Rinkeby will send requests to the mumbai project endpoint and vice versa for n number of defined networks.

## Steps to Reproduce

1. Signup for Infura
2. Create two projects, to receive two separate project keys. For this test I used Polygon Mumbai and Ethereum Rinkeby but you could use Rinkeby/Ropsten if you like or any combination.
3. Deploy a contract to one of the networks. 
4. Watch the dashboard, both project API call counts will increase

## Expected Behavior
Truffle should not consume unnecessary API calls, certainly not from networks that are unused.

## Actual Results

For 1 contract deployment
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6285466/163442348-ca1f5184-7dc4-4b9f-87c0-7c9906268974.png)


For 4 contract deployments, same migration file.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6285466/163440514-74f8eb69-afc7-441f-b759-1adb5ff2848e.png)


Removing the function thunk and defining the provider outside of the config will help to mitigate by reducing the number of providers instantiated but does not solve the issue:

```
const hdt = new HDWalletProvider(
  maticMnemonic,
  `https://polygon-mumbai.infura.io/v3/MUMBAIKey`
);
matic: {
  provider: hdt,

  network_id: 80001,
  confirmations: 0,
  timeoutBlocks: 200,
  skipDryRun: true,
},
```

Results for 3 contract deploys: 34 -> Reduction in 1/3 of unnecessary calls to mumbai project API endpoint when deploying to Rinkeby

## Environment

* Operating System: UBUNTU
* Ethereum client:
* Truffle version (`truffle version`): 5.5.3 (confirmed in latest dev and in `provider-changes` branch)
* node version (`node --version`): 12.22.7
* npm version (`npm --version`):

This one is on me. I was messing with providers trying to get the `Block Polling Error` to throw and had a provider in a project that was not part of truffle's source control. So when I was changed branches it was still in the project when I was doing the deployment and the extra hits I saw were from the provider checking in when it is created.
